title.narrative: Provision of life saving WASH Services to drought affected population in Somali and Oromia regions of Ethiopia

description.narrative: The main objective of this $2.5 million UNICEF project is to increase community access to potable water to address water shortages and to prevent water-borne and water-washed diseases. Among other activities, UNICEF will rehabilitate non-functioning water schemes, conduct borehole maintenance, conduct emergency water trucking, distribute critical sanitation and hygiene supplies and carry out hygiene promotion campaigns. Activities by UNICEF are designed to respond to the current humanitarian situation and to mitigate the projected and unfolding impacts of another failed rainy season. The project provides life-saving assistance to 203,600 people, including 38,684 women, 36,648 men, 65,152 girls, 63,116 boys and 22,396 persons with disabilities.
